verses.text_plain: The righteous perisheth, and no man layeth it to heart: and merciful men are taken away, none considering that the righteous is taken away from the evil to come.
verses.verse_html:
1The righteous perisheth, and no man layeth it to heart: and merciful men are taken away, none considering that the righteous is taken away from the evil to come. ▼
▼ merciful…: Heb. men of kindness, or, godliness
 , ▼
▼ from…: or, from that which is evil

footnotes.body_text: ▼ merciful…: Heb. men of kindness, or, godliness
footnotes.body_html: ▼ merciful…: Heb. men of kindness, or, godliness

footnotes.body_text: ▼ from…: or, from that which is evil
footnotes.body_html: ▼ from…: or, from that which is evil

verses.text_plain: He shall enter into peace: they shall rest in their beds, each one walking in his uprightness.
verses.verse_html:
2He shall enter into peace: they shall rest in their beds, each one walking in his uprightness. ▼
▼ enter into: or, go in
 , ▼
▼ in his…: or, before him

footnotes.body_html: ▼ enter into: or, go in
▼ in his…: or, before him

verses.text_plain: But draw near hither, ye sons of the sorceress, the seed of the adulterer and the whore.
verses.verse_html: 3But draw near hither, ye sons of the sorceress, the seed of the adulterer and the whore.

verses.text_plain: Against whom do ye sport yourselves? against whom make ye a wide mouth, and draw out the tongue? are ye not children of transgression, a seed of falsehood,
verses.verse_html: 4Against whom do ye sport yourselves? against whom make ye a wide mouth, and draw out the tongue? are ye not children of transgression, a seed of falsehood,

tokens.text: yourselves? against whom make ye a wide

verses.text_plain: Enflaming yourselves with idols under every green tree, slaying the children in the valleys under the clifts of the rocks?
verses.verse_html:
5Enflaming yourselves with idols under every green tree, slaying the children in the valleys under the clifts of the rocks? ▼
▼ with…: or, among the oaks

footnotes.body_html: ▼ with…: or, among the oaks

verses.text_plain: Among the smooth stones of the stream is thy portion; they, they are thy lot: even to them hast thou poured a drink offering, thou hast offered a meat offering. Should I receive comfort in these?
verses.verse_html: 6Among the smooth stones of the stream is thy portion; they, they are thy lot: even to them hast thou poured a drink offering, thou hast offered a meat offering. Should I receive comfort in these?

tokens.text: even to them hast thou poured

verses.text_plain: Upon a lofty and high mountain hast thou set thy bed: even thither wentest thou up to offer sacrifice.
verses.verse_html: 7Upon a lofty and high mountain hast thou set thy bed: even thither wentest thou up to offer sacrifice.

verses.text_plain: Behind the doors also and the posts hast thou set up thy remembrance: for thou hast discovered thyself to another than me, and art gone up; thou hast enlarged thy bed, and made thee a covenant with them; thou lovedst their bed where thou sawest it.
verses.verse_html:
8Behind the doors also and the posts hast thou set up thy remembrance: for thou hast discovered thyself to another than me, and art gone up; thou hast enlarged thy bed, and made thee a covenant with them; thou lovedst their bed where thou sawest it. ▼
▼ made…: or, hewed it for thyself larger than theirs
 , ▼
▼ where…: or, thou providedst room

tokens.text: than me, and art gone up

footnotes.body_text: ▼ made…: or, hewed it for thyself larger than theirs
footnotes.body_html: ▼ made…: or, hewed it for thyself larger than theirs
▼ where…: or, thou providedst room

verses.text_plain: And thou wentest to the king with ointment, and didst increase thy perfumes, and didst send thy messengers far off, and didst debase thyself even unto hell.
verses.verse_html:
9And thou wentest to the king with ointment, and didst increase thy perfumes, and didst send thy messengers far off, and didst debase thyself even unto hell. ▼
▼ thou…: or, thou respectedst

footnotes.body_html: ▼ thou…: or, thou respectedst

verses.text_plain: Thou art wearied in the greatness of thy way; yet saidst thou not, There is no hope: thou hast found the life of thine hand; therefore thou wast not grieved.
verses.verse_html:
10Thou art wearied in the greatness of thy way; yet saidst thou not, There is no hope: thou hast found the life of thine hand; therefore thou wast not grieved. ▼
▼ life: or, living

tokens.text: thou not, There is no hope

verses.text_plain: And of whom hast thou been afraid or feared, that thou hast lied, and hast not remembered me, nor laid it to thy heart? have not I held my peace even of old, and thou fearest me not?
verses.verse_html: 11And of whom hast thou been afraid or feared, that thou hast lied, and hast not remembered me, nor laid it to thy heart? have not I held my peace even of old, and thou fearest me not?

tokens.text: And of whom hast thou been afraid
have not I held my peace

verses.text_plain: I will declare thy righteousness, and thy works; for they shall not profit thee.
verses.verse_html: 12I will declare thy righteousness, and thy works; for they shall not profit thee.

verses.text_plain: When thou criest, let thy companies deliver thee; but the wind shall carry them all away; vanity shall take them: but he that putteth his trust in me shall possess the land, and shall inherit my holy mountain;
verses.verse_html: 13When thou criest, let thy companies deliver thee; but the wind shall carry them all away; vanity shall take them: but he that putteth his trust in me shall possess the land, and shall inherit my holy mountain;

tokens.text: but he that putteth his trust

verses.text_plain: And shall say, Cast ye up, cast ye up, prepare the way, take up the stumblingblock out of the way of my people.
verses.verse_html: 14And shall say, Cast ye up, cast ye up, prepare the way, take up the stumblingblock out of the way of my people.

verses.text_plain: For thus saith the high and lofty One that inhabiteth eternity, whose name is Holy; I dwell in the high and holy place, with him also that is of a contrite and humble spirit, to revive the spirit of the humble, and to revive the heart of the contrite ones.
verses.verse_html: 15For thus saith the high and lofty One that inhabiteth eternity, whose name is Holy; I dwell in the high and holy place, with him also that is of a contrite and humble spirit, to revive the spirit of the humble, and to revive the heart of the contrite ones.

verses.text_plain: For I will not contend for ever, neither will I be always wroth: for the spirit should fail before me, and the souls which I have made.
verses.verse_html: 16For I will not contend for ever, neither will I be always wroth: for the spirit should fail before me, and the souls which I have made.

verses.text_plain: For the iniquity of his covetousness was I wroth, and smote him: I hid me, and was wroth, and he went on frowardly in the way of his heart.
verses.verse_html:
17For the iniquity of his covetousness was I wroth, and smote him: I hid me, and was wroth, and he went on frowardly in the way of his heart. ▼
▼ frowardly: Heb. turning away

footnotes.body_html: ▼ frowardly: Heb. turning away

verses.text_plain: I have seen his ways, and will heal him: I will lead him also, and restore comforts unto him and to his mourners.
verses.verse_html: 18I have seen his ways, and will heal him: I will lead him also, and restore comforts unto him and to his mourners.

tokens.text: unto him and to his mourners

verses.text_plain: I create the fruit of the lips; Peace, peace to him that is far off, and to him that is near, saith the Lord; and I will heal him.
verses.verse_html: 19I create the fruit of the lips; Peace, peace to him that is far off, and to him that is near, saith the Lord; and I will heal him.

verses.text_plain: But the wicked are like the troubled sea, when it cannot rest, whose waters cast up mire and dirt.
verses.verse_html: 20But the wicked are like the troubled sea, when it cannot rest, whose waters cast up mire and dirt.

verses.text_plain: There is no peace, saith my God, to the wicked.
verses.verse_html: 21There is no peace, saith my God, to the wicked.
